New Records: Highest-ever partnership in T20 World Cups
England's highest opening stand in T20 cricket
Second-largest union for any wicket in the shortest format for England
Key Match Events: Alex Hales' quickfire half-century at the top of England's order
Jos Buttler setting the tone in the opening over of the chase by smacking Bhuvneshwar Kumar for three fours
Miscellaneous Highlights: England through to T20 World Cup final as Alex Hales and Jos Buttler lead demolition of India
Others: India posted 6-168 with Hardik Pandya (63 from 33 balls) smacking five sixes and Virat Kohli (50 from 40 balls) making his fourth half-century from six knocks in the tournament
Jordan replaced fellow paceman Mark Wood (stiffness) in England's side while Phil Salt was summoned for Dawid Malan (groin)
